Hingga Akhir Oktober, Modal Asing Rp 217 Triliun Masuk RI
01 Nov 2019, 08:08 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Bank Indonesia (BI) mencatat aliran modal asing yang masuk ke Indonesia sejak awal tahun hingga akhir Oktober 2019 sebesar Rp 217,04 triliun.Gubernur BI Perry Warjiyo menjelaskan aliran modal tersebut masuk melalui surat berharga negara (SBN) sebesar Rp 165,2 triliun dan saham RP 49,9 triliun dan ada sebagian kecil ke obligasi korporasi Rp 2,06 triliun."Jika week to date atau selama seminggu aliran modal yang masuk melalui SBN sebesar Rp 4,45 triliun, obligasi korporasi Rp 0,11 triliun dan pada saham ada outflow Rp 0,19 triliun selama seminggu," kata Perry di Gedung BI, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Dia menjelaskan, aliran modal ini mengonfirmasi jika kepercayaan pasar terhadap Indonesia masih cukup baik. Tercermin dari modal dalam bentuk investasi portofolio yang terus mengalir ke Indonesia.Selain itu, hal ini juga menunjukkan kenyamanan pasar terhadap prospek ekonomi Indonesia terhadap kebijakan pemerintah. "Dan juga tentu saja dengan kepemimpinan di Indonesia dari Presiden, menteri dan kami semua untuk bisa menjaga kebijakan-kebijakan kita ke depan," imbuh dia.Simak Video "Hati-hati! Until the end of October, a foreign capital of Rp 217 trillion will be included in the Republic of Indonesia
Nov 01 2019, 8:08 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Bank Indonesia (BI) recorded the flow of foreign capital into Indonesia from the beginning of the year to the end of October 2019 amounting to Rp 217.04 trillion. BI Governor Perry Warjiyo explained the flow of capital entered through state securities (SBN) of Rp 165.2 trillion and IDR 49.9 trillion shares and there is a small portion to corporate bonds of IDR 2.06 trillion. "If week to date or during the week the capital inflow through SBN is IDR 4.45 trillion, corporate bonds IDR 0.11 trillion and in shares there is an outflow of Rp. 19 trillion for a week, "Perry said at the BI Building, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). He explained, this capital flow confirms that market confidence in Indonesia is still quite good. Reflected by capital in the form of portfolio investments that continue to flow into Indonesia. In addition, this also shows the comfort of the market for Indonesia's economic prospects of government policy. "And of course with the leadership in Indonesia from the President, ministers and all of us to be able to safeguard our policies going forward," he added. Watch Video "Be careful!
